column1: Cytomegalovirus Infection of the Retina in AIDS patients
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: the efectiveness is good...am gettin my vision back, don't know how long I will have to take this

column1: Prevention of Cytomegalovirus Disease After Kidney-Pancreas Transplantation
column2: Sissy65, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Took this in heavy dosage after Liver Transplant and the development of CMV. Permanantly affected nerves in legs and feet. Caused intolerable pain in feet, ankles. Considered suicide. My doctor ingored this. Permanant damage done when an alternate med was available. Please, report to your Dr. and demand an alternate med if any nerve pain at all!

column1: Cytomegalovirus Infection of the Retina in AIDS patients
column2: upsidedown, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: HIV+ 27yrs, CMV Retinitis 15yrs. Cytovene 95-2000 when Valcyte pill came out.  2005 Dr said immune sys stable long enough to go off Valycte- had breakthrough within 30 days. Not as effective since, but helps to slow blindness.  Compny chgd copy from $50 to 25% of cost.  Will seek resources for help.  Will advise if I have to ask Roche for med assistance.  Wondering when patent runs out so can get generic unless they can renew and stop that.  It's a cash cow.   Another economic hardship cause by healthcare system and insurance.  I don't wish either of my illnesses on anyone.  peace up

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: worked so far, am hoping there will not be a reaccurrance

column2: Lizzy 3575, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I took it for a few months then stopped because my tongue became so sore and red there was even a tiny bit of blood. May try again on a lower dose. It was hard keeping up with required blood work while I was away from home.

column1: Cytomegalovirus Infection of the Retina in AIDS patients
column2: valcyte, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
Jeankabean@aol.com, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: just started, lost twenty three pounds, have an esophageal ulcer,gastritis, heartburn, reflux, and an ulcer on my ankle- all before I was prescribed this. NOT DIABETIC, WAS TOLD MY BLOODWORK OPPOSITE OF BEING ANEMIC?

column2: nowthereare7ofus, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I really don't know how effective this is.   I have just begun taking it and was doing research (my pharmacist told me nothing) of this drug, side effects, etc.  was wondering if it helped others (should at the cost..luckily this time I have insurance).  I am just beginning today, so I will post back when I have taken for awhile and know more.  Oh, I am taking it for CMV, for which my IGg levels have been very high for 5 years and the acyclovir not helped.  Iv'e been so sick the last 5 years and so many doctors, i hope this works.  Most drs don't even check for this illness!!

column1: Prevention of CMV Infection Post Kidney Transplant
column2: 3-6 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Used this as a liquid med for about 6 weeks after transplant then developed a rash and vomiting, so stopped it. Patient info and all med info I found about this med said that it has not been studied in the pediatric population. Also can react with other anti rejection meds (Cellcept).

column1: Prevention of CMV Infection Post Kidney Transplant
column2: tubabuddy, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medication has done just fine for me.  I can say that without my health insurance I would not be able to afford this medication.  Market price is about 2500-3000 per month.  With my prescription drug coverage it is only $25.00  I can say that I am lucky in that regard.

column1: Prevention of CMV Infection Post Kidney Transplant
column2: 450 2x a day, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had it after an organ (liver) transplant when my immune system was low.

column1: Cytomegalovirus Infection of the Retina in AIDS patients
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: CMV retinitus diagnosis 10 years ago. HIV+ now for 20 years. Blind in one eye but virus has been controlled since then, now with Valcyte. No serious side effects so far. But the thought of necessary lifelong treatment is sort of depressing.

column2: jrb, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: cost over $3300 per month Single lung transplant recipient june 2007 disabled on SS & medicare may have to DIE because i cant afford it. have been on and off this med, going to ACYLOVIR BUT THE INFECTION COMES BACK EVERY TIME I CHANGE.VALCYTE IS SO COSTLY that i dont know how long i can take it.

column1: Prevention of CMV Infection Post Kidney Transplant
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
Jim, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: lung transplant in 2003, new lung has cmv while I do not.I take one pill a day and so far it has kept me free from the virus. My only concern is the cost of valcyte!!! I am on medicare and myself and others suffer not from the transplants but from the cost of VALCYTE which is why we know of many who have given up the chance to live because of the drug. how sad for our country that a drug that does work is sometimes impossilbe to afford.
